title: What is the single most thing holding humans back from living longer? - Quora

response.answer_text: The one single key thing is the rather rapid attentuation of the body's ability to regenerate "brain cells". That is, neurogenesis fails us alarmingly as we hit about 70 and if your brain cells are not regenerating then little else ends up being important. Exercise slows the process, and can "reverse" it a little. But we're talking about 5 years benefit, not a significant extension of lifespan.

Looking for one single answer is not going to work. I would say life’s span is based on the species of the living being, genetics, general health and how body care is received, proper sleep, a happy environment with food and water and housing aware.
